messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: A tribute is a boy or girl chosen for the Hunger Games.  
The Hunger Games is a game on TV.  
It happens every year.  
Long ago, areas fought against the Capitol.  
Now the Capitol punishes them with this game.  
Each area sends one boy and one girl.  
They must be 12 to 18 years old.  
They pick names from a hat.  
The tributes fight until only one is alive.  
The whole country must watch on TV.
Feedback received: Grade 2/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: Factual Inaccuracy. The writer added an unverified time frame in the sentence 'Long ago, areas fought against the Capitol.' The original text does not specify that the rebellion happened ‘long ago.’

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: The Hunger Games is on TV.  
It happens every year.  
The Capitol uses the Hunger Games to punish districts for rebelling.  
Each district sends one boy and one girl.  
They are 12 to 18 years old.  
They pick names from a hat.  
The boys and girls in the game are ‘tributes’.  
The tributes fight until only one is alive.  
The whole country must watch on TV.

The Capitol uses this event to punish districts for rebelling.  
Every year one boy and one girl are chosen.

Text saved: Every year, the Capitol makes the areas feel sorry.  
It shows big games on TV.  
They choose one boy and one girl from each area by draw.  
They are called tributes.  
Tributes are chosen young people.  
The tributes fight until only one is alive.  
The whole country must watch the games on TV.

metadata.feedback_text:
FAIL: Meaning and Fidelity Failure. The MeaningBERT score of 0.7136 is below the required 0.75. The BERTScore of 0.8877 is below the required 0.90.
